Elasticsearch is a robust, distributed search and analytics engine. Hereâ€™s a concise overview of its key components:

  • Cluster: A collection of nodes that work together to store data and handle search requests.
  • Node: An individual server within a cluster.
  • Index: A logical namespace for storing related documents.
  • Document: A JSON object representing a unit of data.
  • Shard: A partition of an index to facilitate horizontal scaling.
  • Replica: A duplicate of a shard for high availability and fault tolerance.
